description: Erection of four new terraced houses comprising of three, two-storey two-bedroom houses and one, three-storey three-bedroom house with associated cycle, car parking and play area
decision_conditions: Condition : 1 - The development hereby permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.

Condition : 3 - No demolition or construction work shall take place on the site except between the hours of 8:00am  to 6:00pm on Mondays to Friday and 9 :00am to 1:00pm on Saturdays and none shall take place on Sundays and Public Holidays without the prior agreement of the Local Planning Authority.

Condition : 4 - Notwithstanding the provisions of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development Order) 2015 (as amended) (or any order revoking or re-enacting that order), no enlargement of the premises or any additional structures/buildings/enclosures within the curtilage of the site shall be carried out without prior written approval of the Local Planning Authority.

Condition : 5 - No development above ground floor slab level shall take place until samples of the materials to be used in the construction of the external surfaces of the hereby permitted have been submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority.  Development shall be carried out in accordance with the approved details

Condition : 6 - Prior to first occupation of the hereby approved development, full details of the Electric Vehicle Charging Points, each capable of  a minimum output of 7.2kW, are submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The details shall include manufacturer's specifications and the number of spaces provided with active and passive capabilities shall comply with the London Plan standards.
The charging points shall be installed in accordance with the approved details prior to the first occupation of the approved development and so maintained at all times thereafter.

Condition : 8 - Upon final commencement of operation of any low and zero carbon technologies, performance data for energy consumption shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The performance data shall be submitted every 18 months to a monitoring web-platform for a period of three years from the point of full operation.

Condition : 9 - Prior to first occupation of the building(s) evidence (schedule of fittings and manufacturers literature) shall be submitted to the Local Planning Authority and approved in writing to show that the development has achieved an internal water use of 105 Litres per person per day or less.

Condition : 10 - Notwithstanding the details shown on the approved plans, prior to first occupation of the hereby approved development, details of secure cycle storage arrangements including manufacturer's specification and elevation drawings, in accordance with both the London Plan and adopted Local Plan shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority. 
The cycle parking shall conform to the WestTrans West London Cycle Parking Guidance and hard surface paths must be provided to the doors of the cycle stores. 
The cycle stores shall be made available to occupants upon first occupation of the hereby approved development and maintained as such thereafter without obstruction.

Condition : 11 - The developments shall not be occupied until evidence (e.g. photographs and copies of delivery notes, invoices or installation contracts) have been submitted to the Local Planning Authority to demonstrate that the development meets the following:
o	At least three of the key elements of the building envelope (external walls, windows roof, upper floor slabs, internal walls, floor finishes/coverings) are to achieve a rating of A+ to D in the Building Research Establishment (BRE) The Green Guide of specification.
o	At least 50% of timber and timber products are to be sourced from accredited Forest Stewardship Council (FSC) or Programme for the Endorsement of Forestry Certification (PEFC) scheme.
o	No construction or insulation materials are to be used which will release toxins into the internal and external environment, including those that deplete stratospheric ozone.
Condition : 12 - Reason: In order to ensure the sustainable sourcing of materials in accordance with the London Plan Policy SI2 and the Mayor of London's Sustainable Design and Construction SPG.

Condition : 13 - Notwithstanding the approved plans, prior to commencement of development (excluding site investigations and demolition), a finalised drainage design and strategy shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority.
This shall include:
- Findings from infiltration testing on the site;
- Drawings and supporting calculations, and an updated Drainage Assessment Form to reflect the submitted details; 
- Details of how the drainage for the development accords to the drainage hierarchy and makes use of green infrastructure technology to comply with the hierarchy set out in London Plan Policy SI3 and achieving a runoff rate which shall not exceed 2.5 litres/second. 
- A detailed management plan confirming routine maintenance tasks for all drainage components shall also be submitted and approved which demonstrates how the drainage system is to be maintained for the lifetime of the development. 
The development shall thereafter be carried out in accordance with the approved details prior to the first occupation of the buildings approved.

Condition : 14 - No part of the development hereby approved shall be occupied until evidence (photographs and copies of installation contracts, along with a written confirmation) has been submitted to the Local Planning Authority and approved in writing to demonstrate that the sustainable drainage scheme hereby approved has been completed in accordance with the submitted final detailed drainage designs.
The sustainable drainage scheme shall be managed and maintained thereafter in accordance with the agreed management and maintenance plan for all of the proposed drainage components.

Condition : 15 - A) Notwithstanding the details on the approved plans, prior to the occupation of the hereby approved development, details of hard and soft landscaping for the entire Bethany Waye Estate, including areas outside of the red line boundary but within the blue line boundary as shown on Drawing Number TP(01)01 Rev: B received on: 28/06/2021, shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. These details shall also include details of play equipment for the proposed play area and a management plan for the landscaping.
Development shall thereafter be carried out in accordance with the approved details and maintained in accordance with such thereafter. 
B) Any trees or plants that, within 5 years of planting, die, are cut down, uprooted, destroyed or become (in the opinion of the Local Planning Authority) seriously damaged or defective, shall be replaced with another tree or plant of the same size and species within the first planting season following its death, removal, uprooting or destruction, unless the Local Planning Authority gives its prior written approval to any variation.

Condition : 16 - No development shall take place until there has been submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority a plan indicating the positions, design, materials and type of boundary treatment to be erected. This shall include details pertaining to the proposed play area. The boundary treatment shall be completed before the buildings are occupied)).  Development shall be carried out and maintained thereafter in accordance with the approved details.

Condition : 17 - The parking, loading and turning spaces shown on drawing No. TP(01)05 Rev: B, received: 28/06/2021. shall be constructed and available for use before first occupation of any part of the development and such spaces shall not be used for any other purposes.

Condition : 18 - Prior to the first occupation of the building hereby approved, an external lighting strategy detailing the specification; location on the building or within the site; and direction of light spill, shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority. Development shall thereafter be carried out and maintained thereafter in accordance with the approved strategy.

Condition : 19 - A scheme for the protection of trees, in accordance with BS5837:2012, shall be carried out in accordance with the drawings/report numbered Tree Report - Dated 27th April 2021, received: 28/06/2021.
The scheme shall secure and facilitate implementation on site of: 
a) Tree Protection Barriers in accordance with the details and positions shown on the approved drawings referred in this condition. The Tree Protection Barriers must be erected prior to each phase of construction commencing and remain in place, and undamaged for the duration of that phase. No works shall take place on the next phase until the Tree Protection Barriers are repositioned for that phase. 
b) The erection of fencing for the protection of any retained tree or hedge shall be carried out in complete accordance with BS5837:2012 and the details approved as specified on the drawings referred to in this condition, before any equipment, machinery, or materials are brought onto the site for the purposes of development or other operations.
Condition : 21 - The hereby approved development shall be carried out in full accordance with the approved Energy and Sustainability Statement (Rev B) dated 25/08/2021 and received on 26/08/2021.

Condition : 22 - Upon final commencement of operation of any low and zero carbon technologies, performance data for energy consumption shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The performance data shall be submitted every 18 months to a monitoring web-platform for a period of three years from the point of full operation.

Condition : 23 - Prior to first occupation of the new dwelling, the applicant shall have entered into a formal agreement with the Council to provide a payment of ?1,574.00 towards its Carbon Offset Fund, as outlined in the hereby approved Energy Statement.
Condition : 24 - The Solar PV panels to be installed shall be of a specification that includes anti-glare technology. The development shall thereafter be maintained as such in perpetuity.
